reviews.title: Very nice, but prefer other hotel in Manila
reviews.text: I have visited Manila twice from the U.S. within the last six months. The last time I stayed at the Shangri la and it was wonderful. On the recommendation of a colleague who I was meeting in Manila, I made a reservation for the Peninsula. I was traveling on business with 3 other colleagues from the U.S. and meeting up with 2 other colleagues from Asia.

reviews.title: Looks too elegant that it does not feel like home
reviews.text: I pre-ordered a taxi before arriving in Manila. When I arrived at the airport, I walked across the walkway and met the greeter at the Peninsula taxi stand. He offered us some water, which was much appreciated.
Our taxi was upgraded from a Fiero to a Mercedes, which was really nice. It was midnight, so it was very dark and there wasn't much to see on the ride to the hotel.
reviews.title: An Elegant Hotel

reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, the security guards did the usual checking underneath the vehicle for bombs, etc and checked my purse.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Check-in was smooth and quick. The bell man led me to my room and while we were walking he let me know that I was staying in a renovated section of the hotel, which was renovated just 6 months ago. He gave me a brief tour of my room which had a fancy and multi-functional control unit next to the bed (think old switchboard size) with the phone, alarm, clock, tv, radio, lights and all controlled from this beast.
reviews.title: Ubiquitous, excellent service and honest staff!

likes.disliked: — a bit of a walk to the malls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a local, the Manila Pen is always a sentimental favorite. I remember my dad taking me there often to have ice cream at the beautiful lobby cafe. I have attended countless wedding receptions there. Heck, my husband even proposed to me in one of the restaurants there! Thus, the hubby thought it fitting to celebrate our wedding anniversary with an overnight stay at the Pen. They were great, we were upgraded to a corner suite which not only was huge but also had an anteroom and powder room. Honestly, we really didn't need all that space as it was just the 2 of us but it gave us a great view of the Ayala Center. They were also very thoughtful and gave us chocolates and a big cake. I think this says a lot about the service at the hotel.
reviews.title: Old World Elegance in the Heart of the City

reviews.text: Since this is a review to help fellow TripAdvisor members, here's the breakdown:
reviews.title: Great quality and consistency of service

reviews.text: Facilities: They are well-maintained and clean but the signs of age are definitely showing. Imagine an all-marble bathroom, luxurious no doubt, but with cracks. The carpet is clean but screams "I was here during the 80's". The pool, although enjoyable, is nothing to rave about. Considering the Pen is my favorite hotel, it pains me to see how it is being left behind by its counterparts in other Asian cities.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: F&B: The food is great and you will not be disappointed. Have the afternoon tea buffet at the Lobby. They also sometimes have ice cream or chocolate buffets. Or a myriad of Asian cuisine at Spices. Even the sandwiches and bread at the deli in the basement is topnotch (I like the roast beef sandwich). Have a drink at the Conservatory. They used to have a really great Italian restaurant and although I miss it terribly, it has given way to the newest Salon de Ning which is a godsend for people who love the nightlife. The interiors are beyond gorgeous and they have great bands that play every night.
reviews.title: A Hotel with High Standards

reviews.text: Shopping: The hotel is walking distance to Ayala Center where the best shopping in Manila is to be found.
reviews.title: Not value for Money

reviews.text: Excellent location, good service, but hotel seems and feels a bit old. Rooms need some renovation. Gym was being refurbished, so it was temporarily located at the mezzanine above the lobby, a bit weird.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: We walked in to a string quartet playing, the staff was incredible, the rooms huge, the lobby scene sociable and the food and drinks great. I only wish I had more time there!
reviews.title: Sooooo nice!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Deluxe suite of Manila Peninsula. The room is Huge! Excellent service I must say! Upon arrival, you'll et a fruit platter waiting by the door. What I like about this is that, there's a letter from the hotel with my name on it. The ambiance, everything in Manila Pen is perfect! I'm so glad I booked with them
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, One of the top Hotels on my list

reviews.text: The Peninsula is one of the better places to stay in Manila and the Filipino hospitality is up to the usual high standards. The rooms are great and its very convenient to all things in Makati. That is why it is very disappointing that the recent changes to the dining room and bar are dysfunctional and annoying.
reviews.title: Changes have not been for the better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is now a dark cavern with much less space to meet guests or take a seat at the bar. The bar stools are uncomfortable and service seems to have dropped. In an effort to be classy they have overused the Italian marble and ruined a perfectly good hotel bar. The dining room has also been renovated and 'improved' with bad furniture, poor food layout areas and you now need to queue up for 10 minutes for the privilege.
reviews.title: A Class Above First Class

reviews.text: This is a nice place with really good service. Their breakie is great. Lovely pool and gym. great spa - really good massages, but if you get room service they massage you on the bed - not so comfortable. The beds themselves are much nicer than most asian hotels - not too hard. free cable Internet in room and wireless in lobby - other hotels charge $10/day. Lots of restaurants in house to choose from. Great atmosphere in the lobby - it is the 'place to be seen' in Manila so is always a hive of activity. Nice music in the lobby as well.
reviews.title: I'll stay there any day

likes.disliked: — no restaurants in the immediate area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 2 towers are very different. ask for a room in the renovated tower - bit more expensive but big difference (I have stayed in the place 3 times). very nice bathrooms.
reviews.title: Best Hotel ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Few negatives:
reviews.title: Absolute luxury

reviews.text: Location is ok but you have no restaurants nearby (that is the only thing the InterCon has going for it over the Pen).
reviews.title: great location

likes.disliked: — some drabbiness, or too much beige everwhere?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: sometimes you have to wait a while for a taxi. Traffic on Ayala Ave is SHOCKING!!! allow time in peak hour - starts at about 9 am
reviews.title: Service has deteriorated

reviews.text: The Peninsula Hotel in Makati/Manila is not the newest hotel in the Philippines capital, nor may it look the most impressive from the outside. What it is though is a first-class hotel, with fabulous interiors, lovely outside pool, and above all exceptionally good service & staff.
reviews.title: Fabulous old world style luxury

likes.liked: — Service, location, pool & spa, food, bathroom in rooms
likes.disliked: — hotel from outside looks a bit delapitated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Peninsula hotel three times and always have I been impressed by the staff service and the beauty of the interiors of this hotel. As mentioned, the pool situated outside is also set in a lovely little garden - nothing in this very peaceful setting would ever lead you to believe that you are in fact right in the centre of Makati business district. The gym & large jacuzzi inside are also in top shape, and sauna is working just fine.
reviews.title: Simply the best in Manila

likes.liked: — Great service, Tight security - but not intrusive, close proximity (5-10 minutes walk) to the best shopping malls, superb breakfast, overall luxury feel.
likes.disliked: — No ATM machine - closest one is 10 minutes away.

reviews.text: The rooms are a choice between older rooms which are slightly outdated in their decor and newly furbished, more Asian style interiors that look more appealing. Regardless, the rooms are very functional and, whats best, the bathrooms are both large and beautifully furnished, with marble tiling and separate large bath tub / shower / toilet areas. Sheer luxury!
reviews.title: Excellent service, lovely hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast menu features a wide variety of Philippino, Pan-Asian and European foods, along with a massive selection of fruits etc.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Manila Pen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for its exceptionally good location, superb service by the well-trained staff, most attractive interiors & dining facilities, and relaxation potential (pool, gym & spa). Whether you are in Manila for business or waiting for a flight to one of the thousands of beautiful islands, The Peninsula Makati is an excellent choice to stay at.
reviews.title: Best Pillows!

likes.liked: — The service and the facilities - in addition to the pillows!
likes.disliked: — Can't get breakfast if you are departing on an early am flight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course it is the best in Manila and Makati.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.text: The lobby is awesome and everything about the hotel just says "class".
reviews.title: Amazing Weekend Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed a few times in the past couple of weeks here and was never disappointed.
reviews.title: Needs room renovation-Club level is C-

reviews.text: A couple of special requests to the concierge were met with smiles and thought - the staff were great.
reviews.title: Manila In Style

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet has all you could need and more.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

reviews.text: Greetings to All,
reviews.title: Nice spot, but not that special

likes.disliked: — The price. Too expensive for what you get.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Peninsula Makati for a few days in October.
reviews.title: Great 5 * experience

reviews.text: This is a pretty nice hotel. The front desk staff were courteous and professional.
reviews.title: Awesome stay!

reviews.text: The standard rooms were only so-so for me. I have been staying at the Shangri-La Makati, but due to unavailability, stayed here for a few nights. The rooms are just not as nice as the Shangri-La. They were also more expensive. Don't take me wrong, this is a nice hotel but I was a little bit let down after the Shangri-La. The Peninsula is a high end chain and the room and furnishings were clean and nice. Just not as grand.
reviews.title: a family hotel....very impressive service

reviews.text: The Peninsula does have a great breakfast buffet and I enjoyed both of my visits there. Large selection of everything along with friendly and professional service.
reviews.title: The spa alone is worth it

likes.liked: — It is a world class spa they have there

reviews.text: I typically do not enjoy the "stuffiness" of most 5 Star hotels, but I enjoyed every minute of my stay during my 2 week business trip at the Peninsula Manila. The warmth and welcome of every member of the staff was incredible. The front desk staff---especially Colleen--- took care of our every need with a genuine smile. The evening staff accomodated each request at turn down (whether it was for extra water,lotion or just privacy) ...to assist with a good night's rest.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Every Minute

reviews.text: I had a standard queen size room which was plenty spacious and had everything I needed. I was on the 10th floor directly on Makati Avenue and so there was some slight street noise. I am a very light sleeper but only used ear plugs 2 or 3 nights. The small mini-bar refrigerator can be used to stash a drink or 2 if you wanted to pick up your ownas ice was provided every evening at turn-down. A dish with some fruit was provided daily.
reviews.title: It's worth your money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Christmas decorations and the live music complemented the good service and food choices in the Lobby Restaurant; a great use of the most beautiful space.
reviews.title: 5 Star

reviews.text: The Buffet Breakfast Stations (in the Escolta) allowed for different and varied meal choices every morning; I loved being able to just order any coffee I wanted each day---and I can't forget to mention the crispy bacon--mmm!
reviews.title: Still my hotel of choice in Manila.

reviews.text: We ate at Spices twice and again, food and service were thoroughly enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great hotel & good location
